availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Native of Harlan County, Kentucky. Son of James and Mary Napier Oaks. Married to Lavina Oaks. Father of Sarah J. Oaks, Mary Oaks, Miranda Oaks and William Oaks. Served as a sergeant in Company K, 14th Kentucky Cavalry, mustered in June 15, 1863, mustered out March 24, 1864. Served as 1st Lieutenant of Company B, Three Forks Battalion, mustered in December 3, 1864, mustered out July 17, 1865.
Owsley County petitioner: Signed a petition for McKinney Maloney in 1864.
